comments.body: Granted it's private, but perhaps a little more detail. i.e. this area is basically padding when expanded, and serves to display the title text when collapsed.
we should never require a particular kind of widget. that's an anti-pattern.

Ah ok. Understood. I thought there was prior art (like CustomScrollView doesn't work if the children Widget don't do certain things). 

I'll break up the CupertinoNavigationBar into 2 versions, one for static and one with slivers like material. Then the `largeTitle` can just be a Text instead of a bool. The iOS APIs allow just a string anyway.
nit: for this kind of thing we like to have vertical alignment of the expressions (sometimes we put the `||` operator on the left to make it come down from the `return`, too).

comments.body:
in general i wouldn't bother with this kind of TODO. Either we eventually add platform themes and remove it, or we don't and this TODO isn't necessary.

I recommend reserving TODOs for more fundamental things where we know there's a limitation to the current implementation but we are intentionally cutting corners for some reason (e.g. because we are waiting an upstream fix).
